abstract: Werner Herzog's latest movie Queen of the Desert, debuting at Berlin International Film Festival, is historical drama with female protagonist whose subject matter diverges from his previous work; Nicole Kidman stars as British historian Gertrude Bell, who had considerable influence on Middle East politics after World War I, but Herzog presents film as love story rather than history lesson.
lead_paragraph: The Berlin International Film Festival features Werner Herzog’s latest movie, “Queen of the Desert,” a love story about the British historian Gertude Bell.

headline.main: Herzog’s New World: A Woman’s Story
headline.print_headline: Herzog’s New World: A Woman’s Story
headline.seo: ‘Queen of the Desert’ Debuts in Berlin

snippet: The Berlin International Film Festival features Werner Herzog’s latest movie, “Queen of the Desert,” a love story about the British historian Gertude Bell.
